addressleaf.section: A Monsieur Monsieur de Sidney chevalier et Governeur de la Ville de Vlissingnes

page.lettertext:
fol.173r
S
r
Thomas Bodley to S
r
Robert Sydney
Cap
t
Wray
hath bin heere, and we have
conferred of
e mater of yo
r
L. letters:
of w
ch
I receaved one by him, and an other
this morning. Before
e messenger can
returne
at yo
wr
L. shall imploy to visit
e places,
e nightes will be too short, to goe
in hand w
t
at enterprise. To disclose
e mater to
e states, for for mine owne part
I dare not, w
t
out warrant from home:
w
ch
yo
w
knowe
e time will not suffer to
attend. I am of opinion, w
ch
is also
e
judgement of
S
r
Francis Vere
, that it will be
best to differ it till October next: at w
ch
time, if ther be no alteration of circ
u
st
a
ces
but that it must be imparted of force to
e states, it may be then done, as here thing
shall prescribe. For it would steede her
ma
tie
exceedingly if it could be compassed
by her self, w
t
out
e states, and that for
sundrie very weightie respectes. I am
nothing in doubt of
e discoverie of these
maters by any of those persons, that deli-
vered them to me: and yowr L. I hope
ca
n
promise for
e rest. I beseche yo
r
L.
because
e partie sent thither of late, was
imploied by yo
r
self, and hath made rela-
tion but to yow, howe it standeth in the
towne, to advertise her
Hig
nes
w
at
yow thinke
of
e mater: as I in my next, will referre
my self there in to yo
r
L. report,
wishing yow
e while all health and happinesse
Hage 26 Ma
r
1591
Yo
r
L. at co
m
andem
t
Tho. Bodley
I have newly receaved a letter from
S
r
Horace Pallavicine
by w
ch
I am advertised,
at the Princes of
Germany
are better
affected than he could expect, promising muche succo
urs
as have been required
w
ch
he is in hope shall be ready to marche
e middle of May.
After I had
